Module Utility Functions Safety¶

utility_safety.safe_distance(v_acc, v_lead, a_min_acc, a_min_lead, t_react, a_acc, a_lead, j_min_acc, j_min_lead, dt, s_x_acc, s_x_lead, a_max_acc, j_max_acc)[source]¶

Calculates safe distance between two vehicles, if both have the same negative acceleration

Parameters

  • v_acc (float) – current velocity of ACC vehicle [m/s]

  • v_lead (float) – current velocity of leading vehicle [m/s]

  • a_min_lead (float) – minimum negative acceleration of leading vehicle [m/s^2]

  • a_min_acc (float) – minimum negative acceleration of ACC vehicle [m/s^2]

  • a_max_acc (float) – maximum positive acceleration of ACC vehicle [m/s^2]

  • t_react (float) – reaction time of ACC vehicle [s]

  • a_acc (float) – current acceleration of ACC vehicle [m/s^2]

  • a_lead (float) – current acceleration of leading vehicle [m/s^2]

  • s_x_acc (float) – current position of ACC vehicle [m/s^2]

  • s_x_lead (float) – current position of leading vehicle [m/s^2]

  • j_min_acc (float) – minimum negative jerk of ACC vehicle [m/s^3]

  • j_min_lead (float) – minimum negative acceleration of leading vehicle [m/s^3]

  • j_max_acc (float) – maximum positive jerk of ACC vehicle [m/s^3]

  • dt (float) – time step size [s]

Return type

float

Returns

safe distance between ACC vehicle and leading vehicle [m]

utility_safety.simulate_vehicle_braking(velocity_list, position_list, acceleration, a_min, dt, j_min)[source]¶

Forward simulation with kinematic single-track model

Parameters

  • velocity_list (List[float]) – list of previous velocity values of vehicle [m/s]

  • position_list (List[float]) – list of previous x-position values of vehicle [m]

  • acceleration (float) – current acceleration of vehicle [rad]

  • a_min (float) – minimum acceleration of vehicle [m/s]

  • j_min (float) – minimum jerk of vehicle [rad]

  • dt (float) – time step size [s]

Return type

Tuple[List[float], List[float]]

Returns

velocity and position list of braking vehicle

utility_safety.unsafe_distance(v_acc, v_lead, a_min_acc, a_min_lead, a_acc, a_lead, j_min_acc, j_min_lead, dt, s_x_acc, s_x_lead, v_col)[source]¶

Calculates safe distance between two vehicles, if both have the same negative acceleration

Parameters

  • v_acc (float) – current velocity of ACC vehicle [m/s]

  • v_lead (float) – current velocity of leading vehicle [m/s]

  • a_min_lead (float) – minimum negative acceleration of leading vehicle [m/s^2]

  • a_min_acc (float) – minimum negative acceleration of ACC vehicle [m/s^2]

  • a_acc (float) – current acceleration of ACC vehicle [m/s^2]

  • a_lead (float) – current acceleration of leading vehicle [m/s^2]

  • s_x_acc (float) – current x-position of ACC vehicle front[m/s^2]

  • s_x_lead (float) – current x-position of leading vehicle rear[m/s^2]

  • j_min_acc (float) – minimum negative jerk of ACC vehicle [m/s^3]

  • j_min_lead (float) – minimum negative acceleration of leading vehicle [m/s^3]

  • dt (float) – time step size [s]

  • v_col (float) – minimum impact velocity of ACC vehicle [m/s]

Return type

float

Returns

unsafe distance between ACC vehicle and leading vehicle [m]
